messages.message: `docker system prune -a` seemed to clear up 400GB of space for me

I think we may have some kind of feedback loop in the build process for some of our container images. Basically:

v1 => builds from source
v2 => builds from source + some output from v1
v3 => builds from source + some output from v2
...

and so on, until the image is gigantic. I haven't proved this yet, but it seems to explode when webapp is restarting a lot. `prune -a` deletes everything, even if in use. Would've been interesting to see a `docker images` output to see if there were any giant images.

I don't run into this problem myself, so next time I can take a look personally.
